params.question: What is an instruction in Polymesh?

answers.text: An official notice to perform an action.
A call to a blockchain function.
It is similar to a transaction in general-purpose blockchains.
An indivisible, or atomic, operation when distributing on Polymesh.

params.question: When it comes to distribution, what is required of recipients when receiving shares?

answers.text: The instruction won't execute, but remains in a pending state.
The instruction executes but only for the recipients who fulfil the compliance requirements.

params.question: What is the purpose of checkpoints?

answers.text: Checkpoints are integral to the network data backup process.
Establish ownership at a specific point in time.
Checkpoints reconcile accounts at regular intervals.
Disaster recovery includes informal check-ins using social media.

params.question: Why does the Polymesh Unique ID System record investor uniqueness claims?

answers.text: To enforce the investor-uniqueness property which consensus relies upon.
This feature will be removed in future versions of the network.
To detect cases where an individual attempts to use multiple accounts to evade reporting requirements.

params.question: Why can users transfer assets between their portfolios in one step?

answers.text: Because a one-step user experience is a superior to two-steps. Eventually, all transfers will be one-step.
Not true; All transfers require both the sender and the receiver to affirm the transaction.
As there is no change of ownership, the transfer does not need to be accepted.
